title: Anacani
text:
"Anacani" María Consuelo Castillo-López y Cantor-Montoya (born April 10, 1954) is a Mexican <a href="singing">singer</a> best known as a featured performer on "<a href="The%20Lawrence%20Welk%20Show">The Lawrence Welk Show</a>" <a href="television">television</a> program.
Born in <a href="Sinaloa">Sinaloa</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, as the sixth of seven children of <a href="Spaniards">Spanish</a> and <a href="France">French</a> parents, she moved with her family to the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> when she was a child. It was during that time she began to sing thanks in large part to her family's talented musical background. When she was in <a href="middle%20school">middle school</a>, during a family trip back to <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, her singing talents were discovered by a <a href="television%20producer">television producer</a> which led to appearances on the <a href="variety%20show">variety show</a> "Las Estrellas y Usted" (The Stars and You) followed by several more appearances on <a href="Latin%20American">Latin American</a> television and live concert tours as well.
After completing <a href="high%20school">high school</a>, Anacani's career took a new turn when she and her family went to the <a href="Lawrence%20Welk%23Legacy">Lawrence Welk Resort</a> in <a href="Escondido%2C%20California">Escondido, California</a>, where she was discovered by bandleader <a href="Lawrence%20Welk">Lawrence Welk</a> himself. Soon enough, she was the resort's singing hostess and later made her first appearance on the "<a href="Lawrence%20Welk%20Show">Lawrence Welk Show</a>" in January 1973. After a few more guest appearances, she was soon hired as a regular performer on the show.
During the course of the show's run, and afterward, she was popular as a soloist with songs like "Vaya Con Dios", "Luna", and "It's Impossible". She also did duets with fellow Welk star <a href="Tanya%20Falan">Tanya Falan</a>, toured with rest of the music makers on the road and released an album called "Lawrence Welk presents Anacani" through <a href="Ranwood%20Records">Ranwood Records</a> and she serves as the <a href="Hispanic%20and%20Latino%20Americans">Latino</a> <a href="spokesman">spokesman</a> for Yuban Coffee. She also had a <a href="bit%20part">bit part</a> in the 1981 feature film <a href="Zoot%20Suit">Zoot Suit</a>.
Today, Anacani lives in Escondido with her husband Rudy Echeverria and her daughter Priscila. In addition to singing, she is also an accomplished <a href="clothing%20designer">clothing designer</a> and <a href="seamstress">seamstress</a>. She still sings with members of her Welk musical family across the country at <a href="county%20fairs">county fairs</a>, <a href="resorts">resorts</a> plus many other venues. She is also a guest soloist with many <a href="symphony%20orchestras">symphony orchestras</a>; and since the early 1980s has worked the <a href="telethon">telethon</a> for the West Texas Rehabilitation Center in <a href="Abilene%2C%20Texas">Abilene</a>, <a href="Texas">Texas</a>.
